New Records: Virat Kohli notched up his 31st T20I fifty to equal Rohit Sharma’s record for most half-centuries in the shortest format of international cricket.
Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli accumulated 78 runs in the final five overs, which is India’s third-highest runs in the death overs in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav scored an unbeaten 68 off 26 balls.
India posted a total of 192/2 in their 20 overs.
Arshdeep Singh picked the wicket of opener Yasim Murtaza.
Ravindra Jadeja took the important wicket of Babar Hayat.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh, Ravindra Jadeja, and Avesh Khan picked one wicket each for India.
Suryakumar Yadav was adjudged the Player of the Match.
Pre-Game Insights: Hong Kong captain Nizakat Khan won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India became the second team after Afghanistan to qualify for the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup 2022.
India will play their first Super 4 clash at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium on Sunday, September 4.
